name: Ken Jennings- The God of Trivia Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: It is hard to think of anyone disliking Ken Jennings, except, perhaps, the dozens of contestants who lost to him! The boyish-looking trivia champion hailed from what US city and state?
questions.explanation:
Edmonds, Washington.

	He actually spent a lot of his early years with his family in South Korea and Singapore.

questions.text: What was Ken Jennings' profession, besides trivia champion?
questions.explanation:
Software engineer.

	He worked for CHG Companies, a provider of consulting and staffing services for healthcare professionals based in Salt Lake City.

questions.text: Ken Jennings had a personal webpage. What was it about?
questions.explanation:
His favorite movies.

	Located at http://jenningsbaby.8m.com, it lists his ten favorite movies, per year, for every year from 1921-2003. It also lists every other notable movie that he has seen from that year, as well as movies that he wants to see but has not yet seen.

questions.text: During his "Jeopardy!" career, Ken Jennings carried a good luck charm in his pocket. What was it?
options: A page from the family Bible
questions.explanation:
A stuffed toy.

	The toy was a Totoro doll he picked up in Japan. Totoro was a friendly forest spirit in the Japanese animated film "My Neighbor Totoro".

questions.text: What unusual mannerism did Ken display during each "Jeopardy!" episode?
questions.correct: Writing his name in a different style
questions.explanation:
Writing his name in a different style.

	He added curlicues, doodles, fancy fonts, and many other variations besides the simple "KEN."

questions.text: During his "Jeopardy!" streak, Ken Jennings was an active participant in the official "Jeopardy!" online forums.
questions.explanation:
True.

	His screen name is KenJennings, and he has often posted on the forums (which can be found at http://boards.sonypictures.com/) He has written such comments as "I've been contacted by both Presidential campaigns, which sort of cracked me up. The system has got to be broken when they're calling game show contestants."

questions.text: Ken Jennings had a quick and quirky sense of humor. When Alex Trebek asked about his winnings, what was his response?
questions.correct: "For the first time I'm actually in favor of the Bush tax cut."
options: "I will do my share to cut down our national debt."
"I'm still not quitting my day job anytime soon"
questions.explanation:
"For the first time I'm actually in favor of the Bush tax cut."

	When his wife Mindy asked him, he told her he would spend it all on DVDs. He reported that she wasn't amused.

questions.text: Which game show record did Ken Jennings NOT break?
questions.correct: Most consecutive appearances on a game show
options: Highest total winnings on a game show
questions.explanation:
Most consecutive appearances on a game show.

	He tied the record of 75 consecutive appearances of Ian Lygo on the game show "100%".

questions.text: Ken Jennings stated he would donate a portion of his "Jeopardy!" winnings to which organizations?
questions.correct: National Public Radio and Public Broadcasting System
options: The Make a Wish Foundation and the American Cancer Society
The Audubon Society and the Sierra Club
The Smithsonian Museum and the Metropolitan Opera House
questions.explanation:
National Public Radio and Public Broadcasting System.

	He also intended to tithe to the Mormon Church and take his family to Europe. He said he would invest the rest towards his family's future.

questions.text: Alas, all good things must come to an end... Ken Jennings finally turned in his crown on which show, and left with how much cash?
questions.explanation:
75th show, $2,522,700.

	He lost to Nancy Zerg after missing both Double Jeopardy questions and the seemingly-simple Final Jeopardy question; "Most of this firm's 70,000 seasonal white-collar employees work only four months a year." He answered "FedEx", the correct answer was US tax firm H&R Block.
